articles.headline: Genetic Changes to Food May Get Uniform Labeling
articles.snippet: A move by Wal-Mart to require labels on products that contain genetically engineered ingredients could be influential in developing a national labeling program.
articles.abstract: A move by Wal-Mart to require labels on products that contain genetically engineered ingredients could be influential in developing a national labeling program.
articles.lead_paragraph: With Washington State on the verge of a ballot initiative that would require labeling of some foods containing genetically engineered ingredients and other states considering similar measures, some of the major food companies and Wal-Mart, the country’s largest grocery store operator, have been discussing lobbying for a national labeling program.

articles.headline: New Way to Deliver a Drama: All 13 Episodes in One Sitting
articles.snippet: Binge-viewing has become such a popular way for Americans to watch TV that it is changing the ways that networks create and distribute episodes.
articles.abstract: Binge-viewing has become such a popular way for Americans to watch TV that it is changing the ways that networks create and distribute episodes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Television producers have turned bingeing, hoarding and overeating into successful prime-time shows for years, but now they are having to turn their attention to another example of overindulgence — TV watching.

articles.headline: Labor Union to Ease Walmart Picketing
articles.snippet: The United Food and Commercial Workers pledged not to try to unionize Walmart workers to avert charges that it engaged in illegal picketing.
articles.abstract: The United Food and Commercial Workers pledged not to try to unionize Walmart workers to avert charges that it engaged in illegal picketing.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s largest union of retail and grocery workers has formally pledged not to try to unionize Walmart workers, even though it helped coordinate picketing, protests and scattered strikes about wages and working conditions at the retailer last fall.

articles.headline: Doubt Is Cast on Firms Hired to Help Banks
articles.snippet: Federal authorities are scrutinizing the private consultants hired by banks to clean up financial misdeeds like money laundering and foreclosure abuses, taking aim at a conflict-riddled, billion-dollar industry.
articles.abstract: Federal authorities are scrutinizing the private consultants hired by banks to clean up financial misdeeds like money laundering and foreclosure abuses, taking aim at a conflict-riddled, billion-dollar industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities are scrutinizing private consultants hired to clean up financial misdeeds like money laundering and foreclosure abuses, taking aim at an industry that is paid billions of dollars by the same banks it is expected to police.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Ben Protess

articles.headline: Timbuktu Endured Terror Under Harsh Shariah Law
articles.snippet: Shops owned by Arabs have been looted in the city and some residents have fled, a foretaste of ethnic strife that many fear will roil Mali for years.
articles.abstract: Shops owned by Arabs have been looted in the city and some residents have fled, a foretaste of ethnic strife that many fear will roil Mali for years.
articles.lead_paragraph: TIMBUKTU, Mali — When the Islamist militants came to town, Dr. Ibrahim Maiga made a reluctant deal. He would do whatever they asked — treat their wounded, heal their fevers, bandage up without complaint the women they thrashed in the street for failing to cover their heads and faces. In return, they would allow him to keep the hospital running as he wished.

articles.headline: Job Growth Steady, but Unemployment Rises to 7.9%
articles.snippet: The jobs report combined with improving statistics on construction spending, manufacturing and consumer sentiment to ease fears that the recovery was flagging.
articles.abstract: The jobs report combined with improving statistics on construction spending, manufacturing and consumer sentiment to ease fears that the recovery was flagging.
articles.lead_paragraph: Political gridlock over fiscal policy didn’t push the economy off a cliff. But it certainly isn’t helping anything, either.
